content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Here is how you can solve this problem:
```julia
struct FloatWithUnits{T<:Real}
    value::T
    unit::String
end

Base.show(io::IO, u::FloatWithUnits) = print(io, "$(u.value) $(u.unit)")
```
This `show` method takes an I/O stream and a `FloatWithUnits` object as parameters and uses the built-in `print` function to write the value and unit of the struct to the stream in the format "value unit". The format is specified inside the `print` parentheses.
